text: Sarah Davis (born June 23, 1992) is a Canadian women's ice hockey player that has competed for the Canadian National Women's Under 18 team. She was named to the roster of the Canada women's national ice hockey team that competed at the 2015 IIHF Women's World Championship.http://stats.hockeycanada.ca/roster/show/1623575?subseason=208392&_ga=1.136259761.1822460774.1427212154 She is the first women's ice hockey player from Newfoundland to be selected for the national team.http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland- labrador/sarah-davis-of-paradise-picked-for-national-hockey-team-a-first-for- the-province-1.2993493 In addition, she is the first woman from the province to have won the Clarkson Cup, achieving the feat in 2016 with the Calgary Inferno. ==Playing career== ===Hockey Canada=== Davis was part of Canada's National Women's Under-18 Team to a gold medal at the 2010 IIHF World Women’s Under-18 Championship in Chicago. As a member of the gold medal winning squad, a hockey card of her was featured in the Upper Deck 2011 World of Sports card series.http://www.sportscardradio.com/index.php/product-previews-a- reviews/714-2010-upper-deck-ud-world-of-sports-checklist In addition, she participated in the Canada Celebrates Event on June 30 in Edmonton, Alberta which recognized the Canadian Olympic and World hockey champions from the 2009–10 season.http://oilers.nhl.com/club/news.htm?id=532636 She was a member of Canada’s National Women’s Development Team that won a gold medal at the 2015 Nations Cup (formerly known as the Meco Cup).http://stats.hockeycanada.ca/game/show/9573877?subseason=198368&_ga=1.263276748.1923401976.1424712796 ===CWHL=== Selected third overall by the Calgary Inferno in the 2014 CWHL Draft, Davis was named as one of the participants in the 2014 CWHL All-Star Game. She made her CWHL debut on October 18, 2014 in a road game against the Toronto Furies, logging her first career goal in a 5–4 shootout loss. Appearing with the Calgary Inferno in the 2016 Clarkson Cup finals, she registered an assist as the Inferno emerged victorious in a convincing 8–3 final. ==Career statistics== ===NCAA=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="background:#AF1E2D; color:#FFC61E;" | Season || GP || G || A || Pts || PIM || PPG || SHG || GWG |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 2010–11 ||38 || 11||21 || 32|| 20|| 4|| 0 ||3 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 2011–12 ||39 ||12 ||22 || 34|| 10|| 1|| 1 ||2 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 2012–13 || 38 ||7 ||18 || 25|| 36|| 1|| 1 ||2 |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 2013–14 ||41 ||20 ||29 ||49 ||28 ||6 ||1 ||2 |}http://www.uscho.com/stats/player/wid,8047/sarah-davis/ ===CWHL=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="background:red; color:yellow;" | Season || GP || G || A || Pts || PIM || PPG || SHG || GWG |- align="center" bgcolor="" | 2014–15 ||24 || 7||6 || 13|| 16|| 1|| 0 ||2 |}http://cwhl_site.stats.pointstreak.com/playerpage.html?playerid=8157889&seasonid;=13281 ==Awards and honours== * 2014 All-WCHA Second Team ==Personal life== On April 17, 2015, a street in Davis' hometown of Paradise, Newfoundland and Labrador was renamed in her honor to Sarah Davis Way.http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/sarah-davis-way-in- paradise-named-after-local-hockey-star-1.3038198 ==References== ==External links== * Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Calgary Inferno players Category:Canadian expatriate ice hockey players in the United States Category:Canadian women's ice hockey forwards Category:Clarkson Cup champions Category:Ice hockey people from Newfoundland and Labrador Category:Minnesota Golden Gophers women's ice hockey players Category:People from Paradise, Newfoundland and Labrador
title: Sarah Davis (ice hockey)
